channel.title: Sound to pitch? tuner?
channel.description:
I'm not sure what you call that: Basically I was wondering if there is a module that can read the audio input, and output a pitch that can e.g. be patched to an oscillator. Or that you could use to determine tune a guitar that you have plugged in. is there something like that?
There was this "external signal processor" in the korg MS20 that could be used to convert input audio to pitch CV. I know this is not easy (and sometimes impossible) to do if it needs to be fast and accurate, especially if you have distorted waves or even chords or noisy input.

item.title: Sound to pitch? tuner?
item.dc:creator: @brucewallace Bruce Wallace
item.description:
@brucewallace wrote:

Yeah axo is capable. It took me a bit of tweaking to get the pitch tracking smooth over a decent range. If you need any help understanding what's going on in my (messy!) patch, just ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Sound to pitch? tuner?
item.dc:creator: @cire Eric
item.description:
@cire wrote:

Hi,
check this thread
https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/pitch-tracking-guitar-synth/6813.
@brucewallace made a very nice guitar synth that you can use.

Read full topic
